intro: Wellstedia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali wellstedia, is a flowering plant native to Somalia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branching. Wellstedia somalensis is often found in rocky areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
